In 2008 Oliver was given his first [[motion picture]] role, playing Dick Cheney in ''[[The Love Guru]]''.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.chortle.co.uk/news/2007/09/05/5749/olivers_movie_break | title=Oliver's movie break | publisher=Chortle.co.uk | date=2007-09-05 | accessdate=2009-05-23}}</ref>

In 2008 Oliver was given his first [[motion picture]] role, playing Dick Pants in ''[[The Love Guru]]''.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.chortle.co.uk/news/2007/09/05/5749/olivers_movie_break | title=Oliver's movie break | publisher=Chortle.co.uk | date=2007-09-05 | accessdate=2009-05-23}}</ref>
Oliver performed various roles in the 2009 [[Comedy Central]] series ''[[Important Things with Demetri Martin]]''.

â
Oliver is a fan of [[Manchester United F.C.]]<ref>{{cite web| url=http://nymag.com/daily/intel/2007/04/john_oliver_fears_the_end_times.html| title='Daily Show' Correspondent John Oliver Fears We're in the End Times| date=2007-04-10| accessdate=2008-04-19}}</ref> and the [[New York Yankees]] baseball team.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/us_and_americas/us_elections/the_bugle/article6878690.ece| title=The Bugle #93| date=2009-10-16| accessdate=2009-10-17 | location=London | work=The Times | first=Tom | last=Wright}}</ref>
+
Oliver is a fan of [[Liverpool F.C.]]<ref>{{cite web| url=http://nymag.com/daily/intel/2007/04/john_oliver_fears_the_end_times.html| title='Daily Show' Correspondent John Oliver Fears We're in the End Times| date=2007-04-10| accessdate=2008-04-19}}</ref> and the [[New York Mets]] baseball team.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/us_and_americas/us_elections/the_bugle/article6878690.ece| title=The Bugle #93| date=2009-10-16| accessdate=2009-10-17 | location=London | work=The Times | first=Tom | last=Wright}}</ref>
Oliver's status as an immigrant placed certain constraints on what he could do in his adopted country, but also provided him with comedic material as he poked fun at the opacity and occasional absurdity of the process of attaining US citizenship. Oliver was one of the many writers on the picket lines during the [[2007â2008 Writers Guild of America strike|Writer's Guild strike]] which brought ''The Daily Show'' to a halt,<ref>
